title: Smith replaces Indian icon as IPL team skipper
text:
Indian Premier League: Steve Smith to captain Rising Pune Supergiants February 19, 2017 8:30pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS AUSTRALIAN skipper Steve Smith has replaced MS Dhoni as captain of Indian Premier League side Rising Pune Supergiants. 
Having finished second last in their maiden IPL season in 2016, the Supergiants have sacked Dhoni as captain on the eve of the annual auction in Bangalore, according to multiple reports in India. 
“Yes we have opted for Steve Smith as captain of RPS for the forthcoming IPL season,” the Times of India quoted team owner Sanjiv Goenka as saying. 
“Our thought is to have a younger captain at the helm of the team this year. We have a very good mix of youth and experience in the team and feel we need a young mind and a young captain with different ideas to spearhead Rising Pune Supergiants.” 
The Supergiants only won five of their games last season despite boasting a squad featuring Dhoni, Smith, Faf du Plessis and Indian stars Ravichandran Ashwin and Ajinkya Rahane. 
Goenka confirmed to the Press Trust of India that Dhoni had been asked to step aside. 
“Dhoni has not stepped down. We have appointed Steve Smith as the skipper for the upcoming season. Frankly speaking, we did not have a good last season and we wanted someone young to lead the side and revamp it ahead of the upcoming season 10,” Goenka told PTI. 
“I have the highest regard for MS Dhoni as a leader and a person. Dhoni continues to be an integral member of our team. He is supportive of the decision keeping the franchise’s best interests in mind.” 
More to come.
